USER PERSONA [Design Agency, Logo design, UI/UX, business card design, social media content design, copywriting, Branding, Motion Graphics Design- United States]

Table 01: DEMOGRAPHICS

| Data points | Answers |
| --- | --- |
| Name | Emily Walker |
| Age | 32 |
| Occupation | Marketing Manager |
| Annual income | $70,000 |
| Marital status | Married |
| Family situation | Two children under 10 years old |
| Location | San Francisco Bay Area, California |

Table 02: USER DESCRIPTION
Emily Walker is a 32-year-old marketing manager living in the San Francisco Bay Area. She is married and has two children under 10 years old. Emily is responsible for managing her company's marketing campaigns and has a budget for design services.

Table 03: PSYCHOGRAPHICS

| Data points | Answers |
| --- | --- |
| Personal characteristics | Detail-oriented, creative, busy, family-focused |
| Hobbies | Running, yoga, cooking, reading |
| Interests | Marketing trends, technology, social media |
| Personal aspirations | Maintain a healthy work-life balance, advance in her career |
| Professional goals | Increase brand awareness and engagement, generate leads, drive sales |
| Pains | Tight deadlines, lack of resources, managing a busy schedule |
| Main challenges | Keeping up with marketing trends and technology, managing multiple projects |
| Needs | High-quality design work that meets her project goals and deadlines |
| Dreams | Building a successful and recognizable brand for her company |

Table 04: SHOPPING BEHAVIORS

| Data points | Answers |
| --- | --- |
| Budget | $5,000-$10,000 per project |
| Shopping frequency | As needed for each marketing campaign |
| Preferred channels | Email, referrals, online search |
| Online behavior | Researching and comparing design agencies and freelancers |
| Search terms | "Marketing design agencies," "logo design services," "UI/UX designers" |
| Preferred brands | Agencies or freelancers with a strong portfolio and positive reviews |
| Triggers | Tight project deadlines, need for new marketing materials |
| Barriers | Cost, quality of work, availability of design services |

To solve Emily's pain points and meet her needs, a design agency could offer the following solutions:

* Provide a project timeline with clear milestones and deadlines to help Emily manage her busy schedule and meet project goals.
* Offer a range of design services to meet Emily's marketing needs, including logo design, UI/UX, business card design, social media content design, copywriting, branding, and motion graphics design.
* Provide high-quality design work that meets Emily's project goals and expectations.
* Provide clear communication throughout the project, including regular check-ins and updates to ensure the project stays on track.
* Offer competitive pricing and a transparent pricing model to address Emily's budget concerns.
* Provide a strong portfolio and positive reviews to build trust with Emily and demonstrate the agency's capabilities.
